import Mathlib

/-- We work in R^n modeled as Fin n → ℝ. -/
variable {n : ℕ}

def Rn := Fin n → ℝ

/-- Predicate: γ is a shortest path from x to y contained in R^n \ S. -/
constant IsShortestPathInComplement (S : Set Rn) {x y : Rn} (γ : Path Rn x y) : Prop

/-- Predicate: γ is polygonal and its corners lie in S. -/
constant IsPolygonalWithCornersOnS (S : Set Rn) {x y : Rn} (γ : Path Rn x y) : Prop

/-- If γ is a shortest path from x to y in R^n \ S then γ is a polygon with corners on S.
    This is the statement only; the proof is omitted. -/
theorem shortest_path_is_polygon_with_corners_on_S {S : Set Rn} {x y : Rn} {γ : Path Rn x y}
  (h : IsShortestPathInComplement S γ) : IsPolygonalWithCornersOnS S γ := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- R^n modeled as Fin n → ℝ. -/
def Rn (n : ℕ) := Fin n → ℝ

/-- Abstract type of paths from x to y in R^n; details omitted. -/
constant Path (n : ℕ) (x y : Rn n) : Type

/-- Predicate: γ is a shortest path from x to y contained in R^n \ S. -/
constant IsShortestPathInComplement (n : ℕ) (S : Set (Rn n)) (x y : Rn n) (γ : Path n x y) : Prop

/-- Predicate: γ is polygonal and its corners lie in S. -/
constant IsPolygonalWithCornersOnS (n : ℕ) (S : Set (Rn n)) (x y : Rn n) (γ : Path n x y) : Prop

/-- If γ is a shortest path from x to y in R^n \ S then γ is a polygon with corners on S.
    This is the statement only; the proof is omitted. -/
theorem shortest_path_is_polygon_with_corners_on_S (n : ℕ) (S : Set (Rn n)) (x y : Rn n)
  (γ : Path n x y) (h : IsShortestPathInComplement n S x y γ) : IsPolygonalWithCornersOnS n S x y γ := by sorry

/-- Abstract type of paths from x to y in R^n; details omitted. -/
constant Path : ∀ (n : ℕ) (x y : Rn n), Type

/-- Predicate: γ is a shortest path from x to y contained in R^n \ S. -/
constant IsShortestPathInComplement : ∀ (n : ℕ) (S : Set (Rn n)) (x y : Rn n) (γ : Path n x y), Prop

/-- Predicate: γ is polygonal and its corners lie in S. -/
constant IsPolygonalWithCornersOnS : ∀ (n : ℕ) (S : Set (Rn n)) (x y : Rn n) (γ : Path n x y), Prop

/-- If γ is a shortest path from x to y in R^n \ S then γ is a polygon with corners on S.
    This is the statement only; the proof is omitted. -/
theorem shortest_path_is_polygon_with_corners_on_S {n : ℕ} {S : Set (Rn n)} {x y : Rn n} {γ : Path n x y}
  (h : IsShortestPathInComplement n S x y γ) : IsPolygonalWithCornersOnS n S x y γ := by sorry

/-- Abstract type of paths from x to y in R^n; details omitted. -/

import Mathlib

/-- R^n modeled as Fin n → ℝ. -/
def Rn (n : ℕ) : Type := Fin n → ℝ

/-- Abstract type of paths from x to y in R^n; details omitted. -/
constant Path (n : ℕ) (x y : Rn n) : Type

/-- Predicate: γ is a shortest path from x to y contained in R^n \ S. -/
constant IsShortestPathInComplement (n : ℕ) (S : Set (Rn n)) (x y : Rn n) (γ : Path n x y) : Prop

/-- Predicate: γ is polygonal and its corners lie in S. -/
constant IsPolygonalWithCornersOnS (n : ℕ) (S : Set (Rn n)) (x y : Rn n) (γ : Path n x y) : Prop

/-- If γ is a shortest path from x to y in R^n \ S then γ is a polygon with corners on S.

theorem shortest_path_is_polygon_with_corners_on_S {n : ℕ} {S : Set (Rn n)} {x y : Rn n} {γ : Path n x y}
  (h : IsShortestPathInComplement n S x y γ) : IsPolygonalWithCornersOnS n S x y γ := by
  exact (by admit)

import Mathlib

variable (n : ℕ)

/-- R^n modeled as Fin n → ℝ. -/
def Rn : Type := Fin n → ℝ

/-- Abstract type of paths from x to y in R^n; details omitted. -/
constant Path : Rn → Rn → Type

/-- Predicate: γ is a shortest path from x to y contained in R^n \ S. -/
constant IsShortestPathInComplement (S : Set Rn) (x y : Rn) (γ : Path x y) : Prop

/-- Predicate: γ is polygonal and its corners lie in S. -/
constant IsPolygonalWithCornersOnS (S : Set Rn) (x y : Rn) (γ : Path x y) : Prop

/-- If γ is a shortest path from x to y in R^n \ S then γ is a polygon with corners on S.
    This is the statement only; the proof is omitted. -/
theorem shortest_path_is_polygon_with_corners_on_S {S : Set Rn} {x y : Rn} {γ : Path x y}
  (h : IsShortestPathInComplement S x y γ) : IsPolygonalWithCornersOnS S x y γ := by sorry
